授業目的: The purpose of this course is to outline the evolution of the English Language.
到達目標:
Students will be able to understand the historical basis for the idiosyncrasies of English.
Students will be able to understand the influence of a variety of cultures and languages on English.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.

第2回: The beginnings – where do European languages come from?
第3回: Old English – the first appearance around 650AD.
第4回: The Normans – French conquerors change the language from 1066AD.
第5回: Middle English – the language becomes recognizable from around 1300AD.
第6回: The Bible and English – how translations of the Bible influenced modern English
第7回: Shakespeare – English in the time of Shakespeare.
第9回: Early modern English – novels, religion, and empire.
第10回: Modern English – the language we use today.
第11回: All around the world – varieties of English around the world.
第12回: The future – how will English change?
トピック.授業外学習2: Each week, students will complete a brief summary of what was discussed in the class and add a small amount of their own research on the topic.
